oai_dc:dc.dc:title: THREE DIMENSIONAL FLOW PROFILES ON LITTORAL BEACHES
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Svendsen, Ib A.
Lorenz, Rene S.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: littoral beach
3D flow
flow profile
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The problem of combined cross-shore and longshore currents generated by waves in and around a surf zone is considered in its full three-dimensional formulation. The equations for the two current components are decoupled and it is found that for a cylindrical coast with no longshore variations the longshore current variation with depth and distance from the shoreline satisfies a Poisson equation. This equation is solved by a perturbation method and it is shown that the longshore velocities are always larger than the velocities found by classical theory. In the simple uncoupled case, the full 3-D current profile is constructed by combining the results with cross - shore velocities determined in previous publications. Also, the total velocities are larger than velocities found from simple depth averaged models.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 21 (1988): Proceedings of 21st Conference on Coastal Engineering, Torremolinos, Spain, 1988.; 52
